attributes.citation: Abatzoglou, J. T.,   Brown, T. J. 2012. A comparison of statistical downscaling methods suited for wildfire applications. International Journal of Climatology, 32(5), 772-780. doi: http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/joc.2312
attributes.description: Supporting Data: Statistically downscaled CMIP5 data (Idaho University) Spatial Resolution: ~6km (US) and 4 km (WUS) Temporal Resolution: Daily Data Format: netCDF Data Type: Modeled Climate Scenarios Reference: Hamlet, A.F., Elsner, M.M., Mauger, G.S., Lee, S-Y., Tohver, I., Norheim, R.A. 2013. An overview of the Columbia Basin Climate Change Scenarios Project: Approach, methods, and summary of key results. Atmosphere-Ocean 51(4):392-415, doi: 10.1080/07055900.2013.819555.
attributes.short-description: These are the deltas, or differences from the 1950 - 1999 averages (not absolute values), for the Puget Sound using CMIP 5 model runs under four RCPs, or Representative Concentration Pathways.
attributes.subtitle: US and Western US
attributes.title: Multivariate Adaptive Constructed Analogs (MACAv2-LIVNEH) CMIP5 Temperature for Puget Sound Region
